headline.print_headline: China and the Toll of Smoking
headline.main: China and the Toll of Smoking

docs.lead_paragraph: The government must warn people of diseases that already cause one million deaths a year.
docs.snippet: The government must warn people of diseases that already cause one million deaths a year.

headline.print_headline: Reports of e-Cigarette Injury Jump Amid Rising Popularity, U.S. Data Show
headline.main: Reports of e-Cigarette Injury Jump Amid Rising Popularity, U.S. Data Show

docs.lead_paragraph: Complaints of injury linked to e-cigarettes, from burns and nicotine toxicity to respiratory and cardiovascular problems, have jumped over the past year as the devices become more popular, the most recent U.S. data show.
docs.snippet: Complaints of injury linked to e-cigarettes, from burns and nicotine toxicity to respiratory and cardiovascular problems, have jumped over the past year as the devices become more popular, the most recent U.S. data show.

headline.print_headline: E-Cigarette Study Data May Raise Concerns
headline.main: Early Data in E-Cigarette Study May Raise Safety Concerns

docs.abstract: Study funded by National Institutes of Health finds that nicotine-laced vapor generated by electronic cigarettes promoted development of cancer in human lung cells in same way that tobacco smoke does; initial findings of study, which is still in preliminary stages, may attract interest of federal officials who are considering how to regulate e-cigarettes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The study, still in a preliminary stage, found that lung cells exposed to e-cigarette vapor showed cancerous reactions similar to cells exposed to tobacco smoke.
docs.snippet: The study, still in a preliminary stage, found that lung cells exposed to e-cigarette vapor showed cancerous reactions similar to cells exposed to tobacco smoke.
